column4: 10k rpm drives don't last as long as 7.2k rpm ones. so unless you need the speed stick with 7.2k drives
10k drives have a longer MTBF than 7.2k drives, and therefor last longer.
the higher the rpm the more wear/tear and in dataserver environments, I've noted that the os drives die quicker than the data ones, (they're the 10k drives!)
